LocationType.name: administrative division
LocationType.description: an administrative division of a political entity, undifferentiated as to administrative level

LocationType.name: administrative facility
LocationType.description: a government building

LocationType.name: agricultural colony
LocationType.description: a tract of land set aside for agricultural settlement

LocationType.name: agricultural facility
LocationType.description: a building and/or tract of land used for improving agriculture

LocationType.name: agricultural reserve
LocationType.description: a tract of land reserved for agricultural reclamation and/or development

LocationType.name: agricultural school
LocationType.description: a school with a curriculum focused on agriculture

LocationType.name: airbase
LocationType.description: an area used to store supplies, provide barracks for air force personnel, hangars and runways for aircraft, and from which operations are initiated

LocationType.name: airfield
LocationType.description: a place on land where aircraft land and take off; no facilities provided for the commercial handling of passengers and cargo

LocationType.name: airport
LocationType.description: a place where aircraft regularly land and take off, with runways, navigational aids, and major facilities for the commercial handling of passengers and cargo

LocationType.name: amphitheater
LocationType.description: an oval or circular structure with rising tiers of seats about a stage or open space

LocationType.name: anabranch
LocationType.description: a diverging branch flowing out of a main stream and rejoining it downstream

LocationType.name: anchorage
LocationType.description: an area where vessels may anchor

LocationType.name: ancient road
LocationType.description: the remains of a road used by ancient cultures

LocationType.name: ancient site
LocationType.description: a place where archeological remains, old structures, or cultural artifacts are located

LocationType.name: ancient wall
LocationType.description: the remains of a linear defensive stone structure

LocationType.name: apartment building
LocationType.description: a building containing several individual apartments

LocationType.name: aquaculture facility
LocationType.description: facility or area for the cultivation of aquatic animals and plants, especially fish, shellfish, and seaweed, in natural or controlled marine or freshwater environments; underwater agriculture

LocationType.name: aqueduct
LocationType.description: a conduit used to carry water

LocationType.name: arch
LocationType.description: a natural or man-made structure in the form of an arch

LocationType.name: Arctic land
LocationType.description: a tract of land in the Arctic

LocationType.name: area
LocationType.description: a tract of land without homogeneous character or boundaries

LocationType.name: artificial island
LocationType.description: an island created by landfill or diking and filling in a wetland, bay, or lagoon

LocationType.name: artillery range
LocationType.description: a tract of land used for artillery firing practice

LocationType.name: asphalt lake
LocationType.description: a small basin containing naturally occurring asphalt

LocationType.name: astronomical station
LocationType.description: a point on the earth whose position has been determined by observations of celestial bodies

LocationType.name: asylum
LocationType.description: a facility where the insane are cared for and protected

LocationType.name: athletic field
LocationType.description: a tract of land used for playing team sports, and athletic track and field events

LocationType.name: atoll(s)
LocationType.description: a ring-shaped coral reef which has closely spaced islands on it encircling a lagoon

LocationType.name: atomic center
LocationType.description: a facility where atomic research is carried out

LocationType.name: badlands
LocationType.description: an area characterized by a maze of very closely spaced, deep, narrow, steep-sided ravines, and sharp crests and pinnacles

LocationType.name: baling station
LocationType.description: a facility for baling agricultural products

LocationType.name: banana plantation
LocationType.description: an estate that specializes in the growing of bananas

LocationType.name: bank
LocationType.description: an establishment for the custody, loan, exchange or issue of money, for the extension of credit, and for facilitating the transmission of funds

LocationType.name: bank(s)
LocationType.description: an elevation, typically located on a shelf, over which the depth of water is relatively shallow but sufficient for most surface navigation

LocationType.name: bar
LocationType.description: a shallow ridge or mound of coarse unconsolidated material in a stream channel, at the mouth of a stream, estuary, or lagoon and in the wave-break zone along coasts

LocationType.name: barracks
LocationType.description: a building for lodging military personnel

LocationType.name: battlefield
LocationType.description: a site of a land battle of historical importance

LocationType.name: bay
LocationType.description: a coastal indentation between two capes or headlands, larger than a cove but smaller than a gulf

LocationType.name: bays
LocationType.description: coastal indentations between two capes or headlands, larger than a cove but smaller than a gulf

LocationType.name: beach
LocationType.description: a shore zone of coarse unconsolidated sediment that extends from the low-water line to the highest reach of storm waves

LocationType.name: beach ridge
LocationType.description: a ridge of sand just inland and parallel to the beach, usually in series

LocationType.name: beaches
LocationType.description: a shore zone of coarse unconsolidated sediment that extends from the low-water line to the highest reach of storm waves

LocationType.name: beacon
LocationType.description: a fixed artificial navigation mark

LocationType.name: bench
LocationType.description: a long, narrow bedrock platform bounded by steeper slopes above and below, usually overlooking a waterbody

LocationType.name: bight(s)
LocationType.description: an open body of water forming a slight recession in a coastline

LocationType.name: blowhole(s)
LocationType.description: a hole in coastal rock through which sea water is forced by a rising tide or waves and spurted through an outlet into the air

LocationType.name: blowout(s)
LocationType.description: a small depression in sandy terrain, caused by wind erosion

LocationType.name: boatyard
LocationType.description: a waterside facility for servicing, repairing, and building small vessels

LocationType.name: bog(s)
LocationType.description: a wetland characterized by peat forming sphagnum moss, sedge, and other acid-water plants

LocationType.name: border post
LocationType.description: a post or station at an international boundary for the regulation of movement of people and goods

LocationType.name: boulder field
LocationType.description: a high altitude or high latitude bare, flat area covered with large angular rocks

LocationType.name: boundary marker
LocationType.description: a fixture marking a point along a boundary

LocationType.name: breakwater
LocationType.description: a structure erected to break the force of waves at the entrance to a harbor or port

LocationType.name: brewery
LocationType.description: one or more buildings where beer is brewed

LocationType.name: bridge
LocationType.description: a structure erected across an obstacle such as a stream, road, etc., in order to carry roads, railroads, and pedestrians across

LocationType.name: buffer zone
LocationType.description: a zone recognized as a buffer between two nations in which military presence is minimal or absent

LocationType.name: building(s)
LocationType.description: a structure built for permanent use, as a house, factory, etc.

LocationType.name: burial cave(s)
LocationType.description: a cave used for human burials

LocationType.name: bush(es)
LocationType.description: a small clump of conspicuous bushes in an otherwise bare area

LocationType.name: business center
LocationType.description: a place where a number of businesses are located

LocationType.name: butte(s)
LocationType.description: a small, isolated, usually flat-topped hill with steep sides

LocationType.name: cairn
LocationType.description: a heap of stones erected as a landmark or for other purposes

LocationType.name: caldera
LocationType.description: a depression measuring kilometers across formed by the collapse of a volcanic mountain

LocationType.name: camp(s)
LocationType.description: a site occupied by tents, huts, or other shelters for temporary use

LocationType.name: canal
LocationType.description: an artificial watercourse

LocationType.name: canal bend
LocationType.description: a conspicuously curved or bent section of a canal

LocationType.name: canal tunnel
LocationType.description: a tunnel through which a canal passes

LocationType.name: canalized stream
LocationType.description: a stream that has been substantially ditched, diked, or straightened

LocationType.name: cannery
LocationType.description: a building where food items are canned

LocationType.name: canyon
LocationType.description: a deep, narrow valley with steep sides cutting into a plateau or mountainous area

LocationType.name: cape
LocationType.description: a land area, more prominent than a point, projecting into the sea and marking a notable change in coastal direction

LocationType.name: capital of a political entity
LocationType.description: capital of a political entity

LocationType.name: caravan route
LocationType.description: the route taken by caravans

LocationType.name: casino
LocationType.description: a building used for entertainment, especially gambling

LocationType.name: castle
LocationType.description: a large fortified building or set of buildings

LocationType.name: cattle dipping tank
LocationType.description: a small artificial pond used for immersing cattle in chemically treated water for disease control

LocationType.name: causeway
LocationType.description: a raised roadway across wet ground or shallow water

LocationType.name: cave(s)
LocationType.description: an underground passageway or chamber, or cavity on the side of a cliff

LocationType.name: cemetery
LocationType.description: a burial place or ground

LocationType.name: channel
LocationType.description: the deepest part of a stream, bay, lagoon, or strait, through which the main current flows

LocationType.name: chrome mine(s)
LocationType.description: a mine where chrome ore is extracted

LocationType.name: church
LocationType.description: a building for public Christian worship

LocationType.name: cirque
LocationType.description: a bowl-like hollow partially surrounded by cliffs or steep slopes at the head of a glaciated valley

LocationType.name: cirques
LocationType.description: bowl-like hollows partially surrounded by cliffs or steep slopes at the head of a glaciated valley

LocationType.name: clearing
LocationType.description: an area in a forest with trees removed

LocationType.name: cleft(s)
LocationType.description: a deep narrow slot, notch, or groove in a coastal cliff

LocationType.name: cliff(s)
LocationType.description: a high, steep to perpendicular slope overlooking a waterbody or lower area

LocationType.name: clinic
LocationType.description: a medical facility associated with a hospital for outpatients

LocationType.name: coal mine(s)
LocationType.description: a mine where coal is extracted

LocationType.name: coalfield
LocationType.description: a region in which coal deposits of possible economic value occur

LocationType.name: coast
LocationType.description: a zone of variable width straddling the shoreline

LocationType.name: coast guard station
LocationType.description: a facility from which the coast is guarded by armed vessels

LocationType.name: coconut grove
LocationType.description: a planting of coconut trees

LocationType.name: college
LocationType.description: the grounds and buildings of an institution of higher learning

LocationType.name: common
LocationType.description: a park or pasture for community use

LocationType.name: communication center
LocationType.description: a facility, including buildings, antennae, towers and electronic equipment for receiving and transmitting information

LocationType.name: community center
LocationType.description: a facility for community recreation and other activities

LocationType.name: concession area
LocationType.description: a lease of land by a government for economic development, e.g., mining, forestry

LocationType.name: cone(s)
LocationType.description: a conical landform composed of mud or volcanic material

LocationType.name: confluence
LocationType.description: a place where two or more streams or intermittent streams flow together

LocationType.name: continental rise
LocationType.description: a gentle slope rising from oceanic depths towards the foot of a continental slope

LocationType.name: convent
LocationType.description: a building where a community of nuns lives in seclusion

LocationType.name: copper mine(s)
LocationType.description: a mine where copper ore is extracted

LocationType.name: copper works
LocationType.description: a facility for processing copper ore

LocationType.name: coral reef(s)
LocationType.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of coral

LocationType.name: corral(s)
LocationType.description: a pen or enclosure for confining or capturing animals

LocationType.name: corridor
LocationType.description: a strip or area of land having significance as an access way

LocationType.name: cotton plantation
LocationType.description: an estate specializing in the cultivation of cotton

LocationType.name: country house
LocationType.description: a large house, mansion, or chateau, on a large estate

LocationType.name: courthouse
LocationType.description: a building in which courts of law are held

LocationType.name: cove(s)
LocationType.description: a small coastal indentation, smaller than a bay

LocationType.name: crater lake
LocationType.description: a lake in a crater or caldera

LocationType.name: crater lakes
LocationType.description: lakes in a crater or caldera

LocationType.name: crater(s)
LocationType.description: a generally circular saucer or bowl-shaped depression caused by volcanic or meteorite explosive action

LocationType.name: cuesta(s)
LocationType.description: an asymmetric ridge formed on tilted strata

LocationType.name: cultivated area
LocationType.description: an area under cultivation

LocationType.name: current
LocationType.description: a horizontal flow of water in a given direction with uniform velocity

LocationType.name: customs house
LocationType.description: a building in a port where customs and duties are paid, and where vessels are entered and cleared

LocationType.name: customs post
LocationType.description: a building at an international boundary where customs and duties are paid on goods

LocationType.name: cutoff
LocationType.description: a channel formed as a result of a stream cutting through a meander neck

LocationType.name: dairy
LocationType.description: a facility for the processing, sale and distribution of milk or milk products

LocationType.name: dam
LocationType.description: a barrier constructed across a stream to impound water

LocationType.name: deep
LocationType.description: a localized deep area within the confines of a larger feature, such as a trough, basin or trench

LocationType.name: delta
LocationType.description: a flat plain formed by alluvial deposits at the mouth of a stream

LocationType.name: dependent political entity
LocationType.description: dependent political entity

LocationType.name: depression(s)
LocationType.description: a low area surrounded by higher land and usually characterized by interior drainage

LocationType.name: desert
LocationType.description: a large area with little or no vegetation due to extreme environmental conditions

LocationType.name: destroyed populated place
LocationType.description: a village, town or city destroyed by a natural disaster, or by war

LocationType.name: diatomite mine(s)
LocationType.description: a place where diatomaceous earth is extracted

LocationType.name: dike
LocationType.description: an earth or stone embankment usually constructed for flood or stream control

LocationType.name: diplomatic facility
LocationType.description: office, residence, or facility of a foreign government, which may include an embassy, consulate, chancery, office of charge d’affaires, or other diplomatic, economic, military, or cultural mission

LocationType.name: dispensary
LocationType.description: a building where medical or dental aid is dispensed

LocationType.name: distributary(-ies)
LocationType.description: a branch which flows away from the main stream, as in a delta or irrigation canal

LocationType.name: ditch
LocationType.description: a small artificial watercourse dug for draining or irrigating the land

LocationType.name: ditch mouth(s)
LocationType.description: an area where a drainage ditch enters a lagoon, lake or bay

LocationType.name: divide
LocationType.description: a line separating adjacent drainage basins

LocationType.name: dock(s)
LocationType.description: a waterway between two piers, or cut into the land for the berthing of ships

LocationType.name: docking basin
LocationType.description: a part of a harbor where ships dock

LocationType.name: dockyard
LocationType.description: a facility for servicing, building, or repairing ships

LocationType.name: drainage basin
LocationType.description: an area drained by a stream

LocationType.name: drainage canal
LocationType.description: an artificial waterway carrying water away from a wetland or from drainage ditches

LocationType.name: drainage ditch
LocationType.description: a ditch which serves to drain the land

LocationType.name: dry dock
LocationType.description: a dock providing support for a vessel, and means for removing the water so that the bottom of the vessel can be exposed

LocationType.name: dry stream bed
LocationType.description: a channel formerly containing the water of a stream

LocationType.name: dune(s)
LocationType.description: a wave form, ridge or star shape feature composed of sand

LocationType.name: economic region
LocationType.description: a region of a country established for economic development or for statistical purposes

LocationType.name: escarpment
LocationType.description: a long line of cliffs or steep slopes separating level surfaces above and below

LocationType.name: estate(s)
LocationType.description: a large commercialized agricultural landholding with associated buildings and other facilities

LocationType.name: estuary
LocationType.description: a funnel-shaped stream mouth or embayment where fresh water mixes with sea water under tidal influences

LocationType.name: experiment station
LocationType.description: a facility for carrying out experiments

LocationType.name: facility
LocationType.description: a building or buildings housing a center, institute, foundation, hospital, prison, mission, courthouse, etc.

LocationType.name: facility center
LocationType.description: a place where more than one facility is situated

LocationType.name: factory
LocationType.description: one or more buildings where goods are manufactured, processed or fabricated

LocationType.name: fan(s)
LocationType.description: a fan-shaped wedge of coarse alluvium with apex merging with a mountain stream bed and the fan spreading out at a low angle slope onto an adjacent plain

LocationType.name: farm
LocationType.description: a tract of land with associated buildings devoted to agriculture

LocationType.name: farm village
LocationType.description: a populated place where the population is largely engaged in agricultural activities

LocationType.name: farms
LocationType.description: tracts of land with associated buildings devoted to agriculture

LocationType.name: farmstead
LocationType.description: the buildings and adjacent service areas of a farm

LocationType.name: ferry
LocationType.description: a boat or other floating conveyance and terminal facilities regularly used to transport people and vehicles across a waterbody

LocationType.name: ferry terminal
LocationType.description: a place where ferries pick-up and discharge passengers, vehicles and or cargo

LocationType.name: field(s)
LocationType.description: an open as opposed to wooded area

LocationType.name: fire station
LocationType.description: building housing firefighters and/or fire fighting equipment

LocationType.name: first-order administrative division
LocationType.description: a primary administrative division of a country, such as a state in the United States

LocationType.name: fishing area
LocationType.description: a fishing ground, bank or area where fishermen go to catch fish

LocationType.name: fishponds
LocationType.description: ponds or enclosures in which fish are kept or raised

LocationType.name: fissure
LocationType.description: a crack associated with volcanism

LocationType.name: fjord
LocationType.description: a long, narrow, steep-walled, deep-water arm of the sea at high latitudes, usually along mountainous coasts

LocationType.name: fjords
LocationType.description: long, narrow, steep-walled, deep-water arms of the sea at high latitudes, usually along mountainous coasts

LocationType.name: ford
LocationType.description: a shallow part of a stream which can be crossed on foot or by land vehicle

LocationType.name: forest reserve
LocationType.description: a forested area set aside for preservation or controlled use

LocationType.name: forest station
LocationType.description: a collection of buildings and facilities for carrying out forest management

LocationType.name: forest(s)
LocationType.description: an area dominated by tree vegetation

LocationType.name: former inlet
LocationType.description: an inlet which has been filled in, or blocked by deposits

LocationType.name: former sugar mill
LocationType.description: a sugar mill no longer used as a sugar mill

LocationType.name: fort
LocationType.description: a defensive structure or earthworks

LocationType.name: fossilized forest
LocationType.description: a forest fossilized by geologic processes and now exposed at the earth's surface

LocationType.name: foundry
LocationType.description: a building or works where metal casting is carried out

LocationType.name: fourth-order administrative division
LocationType.description: a subdivision of a third-order administrative division

LocationType.name: free trade zone
LocationType.description: an area, usually a section of a port, where goods may be received and shipped free of customs duty and of most customs regulations

LocationType.name: freely associated state
LocationType.description: freely associated state

LocationType.name: fuel depot
LocationType.description: an area where fuel is stored

LocationType.name: gap
LocationType.description: a low place in a ridge, not used for transportation

LocationType.name: garden(s)
LocationType.description: an enclosure for displaying selected plant or animal life

LocationType.name: gas-oil separator plant
LocationType.description: a facility for separating gas from oil

LocationType.name: gasfield
LocationType.description: an area containing a subterranean store of natural gas of economic value

LocationType.name: gate
LocationType.description: a controlled access entrance or exit

LocationType.name: geyser
LocationType.description: a type of hot spring with intermittent eruptions of jets of hot water and steam

LocationType.name: ghāt
LocationType.description: a set of steps leading to a river, which are of religious significance, and at their base is usually a platform for bathing

LocationType.name: glacier(s)
LocationType.description: a mass of ice, usually at high latitudes or high elevations, with sufficient thickness to flow away from the source area in lobes, tongues, or masses

LocationType.name: gold mine(s)
LocationType.description: a mine where gold ore, or alluvial gold is extracted

LocationType.name: golf course
LocationType.description: a recreation field where golf is played

LocationType.name: gorge(s)
LocationType.description: a short, narrow, steep-sided section of a stream valley

LocationType.name: grassland
LocationType.description: an area dominated by grass vegetation

LocationType.name: grave
LocationType.description: a burial site

LocationType.name: gravel area
LocationType.description: an area covered with gravel

LocationType.name: grazing area
LocationType.description: an area of grasses and shrubs used for grazing

LocationType.name: guest house
LocationType.description: a house used to provide lodging for paying guests

LocationType.name: gulf
LocationType.description: a large recess in the coastline, larger than a bay

LocationType.name: halting place
LocationType.description: a place where caravans stop for rest

LocationType.name: hammock(s)
LocationType.description: a patch of ground, distinct from and slightly above the surrounding plain or wetland. Often occurs in groups

LocationType.name: hangar
LocationType.description: a covered and usually enclosed area for housing and repairing aircraft

LocationType.name: hanging valley
LocationType.description: a valley the floor of which is notably higher than the valley or shore to which it leads; most common in areas that have been glaciated

LocationType.name: harbor(s)
LocationType.description: a haven or space of deep water so sheltered by the adjacent land as to afford a safe anchorage for ships

LocationType.name: headland
LocationType.description: a high projection of land extending into a large body of water beyond the line of the coast

LocationType.name: headwaters
LocationType.description: the source and upper part of a stream, including the upper drainage basin

LocationType.name: heath
LocationType.description: an upland moor or sandy area dominated by low shrubby vegetation including heather

LocationType.name: heliport
LocationType.description: a place where helicopters land and take off

LocationType.name: hermitage
LocationType.description: a secluded residence, usually for religious sects

LocationType.name: hill
LocationType.description: a rounded elevation of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m

LocationType.name: hills
LocationType.description: rounded elevations of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m

LocationType.name: historical administrative division
LocationType.description: a former administrative division of a political entity, undifferentiated as to administrative level

LocationType.name: historical railroad station
LocationType.description: a former facility comprising ticket office, platforms, etc. for loading and unloading train passengers and freight

LocationType.name: historical region
LocationType.description: a former area distinguished by one or more observable physical or cultural characteristics

LocationType.name: historical second-order administrative division
LocationType.description: a former second-order administrative division

LocationType.name: historical site
LocationType.description: a place of historical importance

LocationType.name: historical third-order administrative division

LocationType.description: an undersea feature whose existence has been subsequently disproved

LocationType.description: a residence, owner's or manager's, on a sheep or cattle station, woolshed, outcamp, or Aboriginal outstation, specific to Australia and New Zealand

LocationType.name: hospital
LocationType.description: a building in which sick or injured, especially those confined to bed, are medically treated

LocationType.name: hot spring(s)
LocationType.description: a place where hot ground water flows naturally out of the ground

LocationType.name: hotel
LocationType.description: a building providing lodging and/or meals for the public

LocationType.name: house(s)
LocationType.description: a building used as a human habitation

LocationType.description: a tract of land on which many houses of similar design are built according to a development plan

LocationType.description: a tract of land used primarily for hunting

LocationType.description: an area characterized by industrial activity

LocationType.description: a station at which vehicles, goods, and people are inspected

LocationType.description: a long wind-swept trough between parallel longitudinal dunes

LocationType.description: a mine where iron ore is extracted

LocationType.description: a tract of level or terraced land which is irrigated

LocationType.description: a camp used by migrant or temporary laborers

LocationType.name: lagoon
LocationType.description: a shallow coastal waterbody, completely or partly separated from a larger body of water by a barrier island, coral reef or other depositional feature

LocationType.name: lagoons
LocationType.description: shallow coastal waterbodies, completely or partly separated from a larger body of water by a barrier island, coral reef or other depositional feature

LocationType.name: lake
LocationType.description: a large inland body of standing water

LocationType.name: lake bed(s)
LocationType.description: a dried up or drained area of a former lake

LocationType.name: lake channel(s)
LocationType.description: that part of a lake having water deep enough for navigation between islands, shoals, etc.

LocationType.name: lake region
LocationType.description: a tract of land distinguished by numerous lakes

LocationType.name: lakes
LocationType.description: large inland bodies of standing water

LocationType.name: land-tied island
LocationType.description: a coastal island connected to the mainland by barrier beaches, levees or dikes

LocationType.name: landfill
LocationType.description: a place for trash and garbage disposal in which the waste is buried between layers of earth to build up low-lying land

LocationType.name: landing
LocationType.description: a place where boats receive or discharge passengers and freight, but lacking most port facilities

LocationType.name: lava area
LocationType.description: an area of solidified lava

LocationType.name: lead mine(s)
LocationType.description: a mine where lead ore is extracted

LocationType.name: leased area
LocationType.description: a tract of land leased by the United Kingdom from the People's Republic of China to form part of Hong Kong

LocationType.name: leper colony
LocationType.description: a settled area inhabited by lepers in relative isolation

LocationType.name: leprosarium
LocationType.description: an asylum or hospital for lepers

LocationType.name: levee
LocationType.description: a natural low embankment bordering a distributary or meandering stream; often built up artificially to control floods

LocationType.name: lighthouse
LocationType.description: a distinctive structure exhibiting a major navigation light

LocationType.name: limekiln
LocationType.description: a furnace in which limestone is reduced to lime

LocationType.name: local government office
LocationType.description: a facility housing local governmental offices, usually a city, town, or village hall

LocationType.name: locality
LocationType.description: a minor area or place of unspecified or mixed character and indefinite boundaries

LocationType.name: lock(s)
LocationType.description: a basin in a waterway with gates at each end by means of which vessels are passed from one water level to another

LocationType.name: logging camp
LocationType.description: a camp used by loggers

LocationType.name: lost river
LocationType.description: a surface stream that disappears into an underground channel, or dries up in an arid area

LocationType.name: maneuver area
LocationType.description: a tract of land where military field exercises are carried out

LocationType.name: mangrove island
LocationType.description: a mangrove swamp surrounded by a waterbody

LocationType.name: mangrove swamp
LocationType.description: a tropical tidal mud flat characterized by mangrove vegetation

LocationType.name: marina
LocationType.description: a harbor facility for small boats, yachts, etc.

LocationType.name: marine channel
LocationType.description: that part of a body of water deep enough for navigation through an area otherwise not suitable

LocationType.name: maritime school
LocationType.description: a school at which maritime sciences form the core of the curriculum

LocationType.name: market
LocationType.description: a place where goods are bought and sold at regular intervals

LocationType.name: marsh(es)
LocationType.description: a wetland dominated by grass-like vegetation

LocationType.name: meadow
LocationType.description: a small, poorly drained area dominated by grassy vegetation

LocationType.name: meander neck
LocationType.description: a narrow strip of land between the two limbs of a meander loop at its narrowest point

LocationType.name: medical center
LocationType.description: a complex of health care buildings including two or more of the following: hospital, medical school, clinic, pharmacy, doctor's offices, etc.

LocationType.name: mesa(s)
LocationType.description: a flat-topped, isolated elevation with steep slopes on all sides, less extensive than a plateau

LocationType.name: meteorological station
LocationType.description: a station at which weather elements are recorded

LocationType.name: military base
LocationType.description: a place used by an army or other armed service for storing arms and supplies, and for accommodating and training troops, a base from which operations can be initiated

LocationType.name: military installation
LocationType.description: a facility for use of and control by armed forces

LocationType.name: military school
LocationType.description: a school at which military science forms the core of the curriculum

LocationType.name: mill(s)
LocationType.description: a building housing machines for transforming, shaping, finishing, grinding, or extracting products

LocationType.name: mine(s)
LocationType.description: a site where mineral ores are extracted from the ground by excavating surface pits and subterranean passages

LocationType.name: mining area
LocationType.description: an area of mine sites where minerals and ores are extracted

LocationType.name: mining camp
LocationType.description: a camp used by miners

LocationType.name: mission
LocationType.description: a place characterized by dwellings, school, church, hospital and other facilities operated by a religious group for the purpose of providing charitable services and to propagate religion

LocationType.name: mole
LocationType.description: a massive structure of masonry or large stones serving as a pier or breakwater

LocationType.name: monastery
LocationType.description: a building and grounds where a community of monks lives in seclusion

LocationType.name: monument
LocationType.description: a commemorative structure or statue

LocationType.name: moor(s)
LocationType.description: an area of open ground overlaid with wet peaty soils

LocationType.name: moraine
LocationType.description: a mound, ridge, or other accumulation of glacial till

LocationType.name: mosque
LocationType.description: a building for public Islamic worship

LocationType.name: mound(s)
LocationType.description: a low, isolated, rounded hill

LocationType.name: mountain
LocationType.description: an elevation standing high above the surrounding area with small summit area, steep slopes and local relief of 300m or more

LocationType.name: mountains
LocationType.description: a mountain range or a group of mountains or high ridges

LocationType.name: mud flat(s)
LocationType.description: a relatively level area of mud either between high and low tide lines, or subject to flooding

LocationType.name: munitions plant
LocationType.description: a factory where ammunition is made

LocationType.name: museum
LocationType.description: a building where objects of permanent interest in one or more of the arts and sciences are preserved and exhibited

LocationType.name: narrows
LocationType.description: a navigable narrow part of a bay, strait, river, etc.

LocationType.name: natural tunnel
LocationType.description: a cave that is open at both ends

LocationType.name: nature reserve
LocationType.description: an area reserved for the maintenance of a natural habitat

LocationType.name: naval base
LocationType.description: an area used to store supplies, provide barracks for troops and naval personnel, a port for naval vessels, and from which operations are initiated

LocationType.name: navigation canal(s)
LocationType.description: a watercourse constructed for navigation of vessels

LocationType.name: navigation channel
LocationType.description: a buoyed channel of sufficient depth for the safe navigation of vessels

LocationType.name: nickel mine(s)
LocationType.description: a mine where nickel ore is extracted

LocationType.name: novitiate
LocationType.description: a religious house or school where novices are trained

LocationType.name: nuclear power station
LocationType.description: nuclear power station

LocationType.name: nunatak
LocationType.description: a rock or mountain peak protruding through glacial ice

LocationType.name: nunataks
LocationType.description: rocks or mountain peaks protruding through glacial ice

LocationType.name: nursery(-ies)
LocationType.description: a place where plants are propagated for transplanting or grafting

LocationType.name: oasis(-es)
LocationType.description: an area in a desert made productive by the availability of water

LocationType.name: observation point
LocationType.description: a wildlife or scenic observation point

LocationType.name: observatory
LocationType.description: a facility equipped for observation of atmospheric or space phenomena

LocationType.name: ocean
LocationType.description: one of the major divisions of the vast expanse of salt water covering part of the earth

LocationType.name: office building
LocationType.description: commercial building where business and/or services are conducted

LocationType.name: oil camp
LocationType.description: a camp used by oilfield workers

LocationType.name: oil palm plantation
LocationType.description: an estate specializing in the cultivation of oil palm trees

LocationType.name: oil pipeline
LocationType.description: a pipeline used for transporting oil

LocationType.name: oil pipeline junction
LocationType.description: a section of an oil pipeline where two or more pipes join together

LocationType.name: oil pipeline terminal
LocationType.description: a tank farm or loading facility at the end of an oil pipeline

LocationType.name: oil pumping station
LocationType.description: a facility for pumping oil through a pipeline

LocationType.name: oil refinery
LocationType.description: a facility for converting crude oil into refined petroleum products

LocationType.name: oil well
LocationType.description: a well from which oil may be pumped

LocationType.name: oilfield
LocationType.description: an area containing a subterranean store of petroleum of economic value

LocationType.name: olive grove
LocationType.description: a planting of olive trees

LocationType.name: olive oil mill
LocationType.description: a mill where oil is extracted from olives

LocationType.name: orchard(s)
LocationType.description: a planting of fruit or nut trees

LocationType.name: ore treatment plant
LocationType.description: a facility for improving the metal content of ore by concentration

LocationType.name: overfalls
LocationType.description: an area of breaking waves caused by the meeting of currents or by waves moving against the current

LocationType.name: oxbow lake
LocationType.description: a crescent-shaped lake commonly found adjacent to meandering streams

LocationType.name: pagoda
LocationType.description: a tower-like storied structure, usually a Buddhist shrine

LocationType.name: palace
LocationType.description: a large stately house, often a royal or presidential residence

LocationType.name: palm grove
LocationType.description: a planting of palm trees

LocationType.name: palm tree reserve
LocationType.description: an area of palm trees where use is controlled

LocationType.name: pan
LocationType.description: a near-level shallow, natural depression or basin, usually containing an intermittent lake, pond, or pool

LocationType.name: pans
LocationType.description: a near-level shallow, natural depression or basin, usually containing an intermittent lake, pond, or pool

LocationType.name: parish
LocationType.description: an ecclesiastical district

LocationType.name: park
LocationType.description: an area, often of forested land, maintained as a place of beauty, or for recreation

LocationType.name: park gate
LocationType.description: a controlled access to a park

LocationType.name: park headquarters
LocationType.description: a park administrative facility

LocationType.name: parking garage
LocationType.description: a building or underground facility used exclusively for parking vehicles

LocationType.name: parking lot
LocationType.description: an area used for parking vehicles

LocationType.name: pass
LocationType.description: a break in a mountain range or other high obstruction, used for transportation from one side to the other [See also gap]

LocationType.name: patrol post
LocationType.description: a post from which patrols are sent out

LocationType.name: peak
LocationType.description: a pointed elevation atop a mountain, ridge, or other hypsographic feature

LocationType.name: peaks
LocationType.description: pointed elevations atop a mountain, ridge, or other hypsographic features

LocationType.name: peat cutting area
LocationType.description: an area where peat is harvested

LocationType.name: peninsula
LocationType.description: an elongate area of land projecting into a body of water and nearly surrounded by water

LocationType.name: petroleum basin
LocationType.description: an area underlain by an oil-rich structural basin

LocationType.name: phosphate works
LocationType.description: a facility for producing fertilizer

LocationType.name: pier
LocationType.description: a structure built out into navigable water on piles providing berthing for ships and recreation

LocationType.name: pine grove
LocationType.description: a planting of pine trees

LocationType.name: placer mine(s)
LocationType.description: a place where heavy metals are concentrated and running water is used to extract them from unconsolidated sediments

LocationType.name: plain(s)
LocationType.description: an extensive area of comparatively level to gently undulating land, lacking surface irregularities, and usually adjacent to a higher area

LocationType.name: plateau
LocationType.description: an elevated plain with steep slopes on one or more sides, and often with incised streams

LocationType.name: point
LocationType.description: a tapering piece of land projecting into a body of water, less prominent than a cape

LocationType.name: points
LocationType.description: tapering pieces of land projecting into a body of water, less prominent than a cape

LocationType.name: polder
LocationType.description: an area reclaimed from the sea by diking and draining

LocationType.name: police post
LocationType.description: a building in which police are stationed

LocationType.name: political entity
LocationType.description: political entity

LocationType.name: pond
LocationType.description: a small standing waterbody

LocationType.name: ponds
LocationType.description: small standing waterbodies

LocationType.name: pool(s)
LocationType.description: a small and comparatively still, deep part of a larger body of water such as a stream or harbor; or a small body of standing water

LocationType.name: populated locality
LocationType.description: an area similar to a locality but with a small group of dwellings or other buildings

LocationType.name: populated place
LocationType.description: a city, town, village, or other agglomeration of buildings where people live and work

LocationType.name: populated places
LocationType.description: cities, towns, villages, or other agglomerations of buildings where people live and work

LocationType.name: port
LocationType.description: a place provided with terminal and transfer facilities for loading and discharging waterborne cargo or passengers, usually located in a harbor

LocationType.name: portage
LocationType.description: a place where boats, goods, etc., are carried overland between navigable waters

LocationType.name: post office
LocationType.description: a public building in which mail is received, sorted and distributed

LocationType.name: power station
LocationType.description: a facility for generating electric power

LocationType.name: prison
LocationType.description: a facility for confining prisoners

LocationType.name: promenade
LocationType.description: a place for public walking, usually along a beach front

LocationType.name: promontory(-ies)
LocationType.description: a bluff or prominent hill overlooking or projecting into a lowland

LocationType.name: pyramid
LocationType.description: an ancient massive structure of square ground plan with four triangular faces meeting at a point and used for enclosing tombs

LocationType.name: pyramids
LocationType.description: ancient massive structures of square ground plan with four triangular faces meeting at a point and used for enclosing tombs

LocationType.name: quarry(-ies)
LocationType.description: a surface mine where building stone or gravel and sand, etc. are extracted

LocationType.name: quay
LocationType.description: a structure of solid construction along a shore or bank which provides berthing for ships and which generally provides cargo handling facilities

LocationType.name: quicksand
LocationType.description: an area where loose sand with water moving through it may become unstable when heavy objects are placed at the surface, causing them to sink

LocationType.name: racetrack
LocationType.description: a track where races are held

LocationType.name: radio observatory
LocationType.description: a facility equipped with an array of antennae for receiving radio waves from space

LocationType.name: radio station
LocationType.description: a facility for producing and transmitting information by radio waves

LocationType.name: railroad
LocationType.description: a permanent twin steel-rail track on which freight and passenger cars move long distances

LocationType.name: railroad junction
LocationType.description: a place where two or more railroad tracks join

LocationType.name: railroad siding
LocationType.description: a short track parallel to and joining the main track

LocationType.name: railroad signal
LocationType.description: a signal at the entrance of a particular section of track governing the movement of trains

LocationType.name: railroad station
LocationType.description: a facility comprising ticket office, platforms, etc. for loading and unloading train passengers and freight

LocationType.name: railroad stop
LocationType.description: a place lacking station facilities where trains stop to pick up and unload passengers and freight

LocationType.name: railroad tunnel
LocationType.description: a tunnel through which a railroad passes

LocationType.name: railroad yard
LocationType.description: a system of tracks used for the making up of trains, and switching and storing freight cars

LocationType.name: ranch(es)
LocationType.description: a large farm specializing in extensive grazing of livestock

LocationType.name: rapids
LocationType.description: a turbulent section of a stream associated with a steep, irregular stream bed

LocationType.name: ravine(s)
LocationType.description: a small, narrow, deep, steep-sided stream channel, smaller than a gorge

LocationType.name: reach
LocationType.description: a straight section of a navigable stream or channel between two bends

LocationType.name: reef(s)
LocationType.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of consolidated material

LocationType.name: reformatory
LocationType.description: a facility for confining, training, and reforming young law offenders

LocationType.name: refugee camp
LocationType.description: a camp used by refugees

LocationType.name: region
LocationType.description: an area distinguished by one or more observable physical or cultural characteristics

LocationType.name: religious center
LocationType.description: a facility where more than one religious activity is carried out, e.g., retreat, school, monastery, worship

LocationType.name: religious populated place
LocationType.description: a populated place whose population is largely engaged in religious occupations

LocationType.name: religious site
LocationType.description: an ancient site of significant religious importance

LocationType.name: research institute
LocationType.description: a facility where research is carried out

LocationType.name: reservation
LocationType.description: a tract of land set aside for aboriginal, tribal, or native populations

LocationType.name: reserve
LocationType.description: a tract of public land reserved for future use or restricted as to use

LocationType.name: reservoir(s)
LocationType.description: an artificial pond or lake

LocationType.name: resort
LocationType.description: a specialized facility for vacation, health, or participation sports activities

LocationType.name: resthouse
LocationType.description: a structure maintained for the rest and shelter of travelers

LocationType.name: retreat
LocationType.description: a place of temporary seclusion, especially for religious groups

LocationType.name: ridge(s)
LocationType.description: a long narrow elevation with steep sides, and a more or less continuous crest

LocationType.name: road
LocationType.description: an open way with improved surface for transportation of animals, people and vehicles

LocationType.name: road bend
LocationType.description: a conspicuously curved or bent section of a road

LocationType.name: road cut
LocationType.description: an excavation cut through a hill or ridge for a road

LocationType.name: road junction
LocationType.description: a place where two or more roads join

LocationType.name: road tunnel
LocationType.description: a tunnel through which a road passes

LocationType.name: roadstead
LocationType.description: an open anchorage affording less protection than a harbor

LocationType.name: rock
LocationType.description: a conspicuous, isolated rocky mass

LocationType.name: rock desert
LocationType.description: a relatively sand-free, high bedrock plateau in a hot desert, with or without a gravel veneer

LocationType.name: rockfall
LocationType.description: an irregular mass of fallen rock at the base of a cliff or steep slope

LocationType.name: rocks
LocationType.description: conspicuous, isolated rocky masses

LocationType.name: rookery
LocationType.description: a breeding place of a colony of birds or seals

LocationType.name: rubber plantation
LocationType.description: an estate which specializes in growing and tapping rubber trees

LocationType.name: ruin(s)
LocationType.description: a destroyed or decayed structure which is no longer functional

LocationType.name: ruined bridge
LocationType.description: a destroyed or decayed bridge which is no longer functional

LocationType.name: ruined dam
LocationType.description: a destroyed or decayed dam which is no longer functional

LocationType.name: sabkha(s)
LocationType.description: a salt flat or salt encrusted plain subject to periodic inundation from flooding or high tides

LocationType.name: saddle
LocationType.description: a broad, open pass crossing a ridge or between hills or mountains

LocationType.name: salt area
LocationType.description: a shallow basin or flat where salt accumulates after periodic inundation

LocationType.name: salt evaporation ponds
LocationType.description: diked salt ponds used in the production of solar evaporated salt

LocationType.name: salt lake
LocationType.description: an inland body of salt water with no outlet

LocationType.name: salt lakes
LocationType.description: inland bodies of salt water with no outlet

LocationType.name: salt marsh
LocationType.description: a flat area, subject to periodic salt water inundation, dominated by grassy salt-tolerant plants

LocationType.name: salt mine(s)
LocationType.description: a mine from which salt is extracted

LocationType.name: salt pond
LocationType.description: a small standing body of salt water often in a marsh or swamp, usually along a seacoast

LocationType.name: salt ponds
LocationType.description: small standing bodies of salt water often in a marsh or swamp, usually along a seacoast

LocationType.name: sanatorium
LocationType.description: a facility where victims of physical or mental disorders are treated

LocationType.name: sand area
LocationType.description: a tract of land covered with sand

LocationType.name: sandy desert
LocationType.description: an extensive tract of shifting sand and sand dunes

LocationType.name: satellite station
LocationType.description: a facility for tracking and communicating with orbiting satellites

LocationType.name: sawmill
LocationType.description: a mill where logs or lumber are sawn to specified shapes and sizes

LocationType.name: school
LocationType.description: building(s) where instruction in one or more branches of knowledge takes place

LocationType.name: school district
LocationType.description: school district

LocationType.name: scientific research base
LocationType.description: a scientific facility used as a base from which research is carried out or monitored

LocationType.name: scrubland
LocationType.description: an area of low trees, bushes, and shrubs stunted by some environmental limitation

LocationType.name: sea
LocationType.description: a large body of salt water more or less confined by continuous land or chains of islands forming a subdivision of an ocean

LocationType.name: seachannel
LocationType.description: a continuously sloping, elongated depression commonly found in fans or plains and customarily bordered by levees on one or two sides

LocationType.name: seachannels
LocationType.description: continuously sloping, elongated depressions commonly found in fans or plains and customarily bordered by levees on one or two sides

LocationType.name: seamount
LocationType.description: an elevation rising generally more than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summit

LocationType.name: seamounts
LocationType.description: elevations rising generally more than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summit

LocationType.name: seaplane landing area
LocationType.description: a place on a waterbody where floatplanes land and take off

LocationType.name: seat of a first-order administrative division
LocationType.description: seat of a first-order administrative division (PPLC takes precedence over PPLA)

LocationType.name: seat of a fourth-order administrative division
LocationType.description: seat of a fourth-order administrative division

LocationType.name: seat of a second-order administrative division
LocationType.description: seat of a second-order administrative division

LocationType.name: seat of a third-order administrative division
LocationType.description: seat of a third-order administrative division

LocationType.name: second-order administrative division
LocationType.description: a subdivision of a first-order administrative division

LocationType.description: section of bank

LocationType.description: section of estate

LocationType.description: section of independent political entity

LocationType.description: section of intermittent stream

LocationType.description: section of island

LocationType.name: section of lagoon
LocationType.description: section of lagoon

LocationType.description: section of lake

LocationType.description: section of peninsula

LocationType.description: section of plain

LocationType.description: section of plateau

LocationType.name: section of reef
LocationType.description: section of reef

LocationType.name: section of stream
LocationType.description: section of stream

LocationType.name: section of valley
LocationType.description: section of valley

LocationType.name: section of wadi
LocationType.description: section of wadi

LocationType.name: section of waterfall(s)
LocationType.description: section of waterfall(s)

LocationType.name: semi-independent political entity
LocationType.description: semi-independent political entity

LocationType.name: sewage treatment plant
LocationType.description: facility for the processing of sewage and/or wastewater

LocationType.name: sheepfold
LocationType.description: a fence or wall enclosure for sheep and other small herd animals

LocationType.name: shoal(s)
LocationType.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of unconsolidated material

LocationType.name: shopping center or mall
LocationType.description: an urban shopping area featuring a variety of shops surrounding a usually open-air concourse reserved for pedestrian traffic; or a large suburban building or group of buildings containing various shops with associated passageways

LocationType.name: shore
LocationType.description: a narrow zone bordering a waterbody which covers and uncovers at high and low water, respectively

LocationType.name: shrine
LocationType.description: a structure or place memorializing a person or religious concept

LocationType.name: sill
LocationType.description: the low part of a gap or saddle separating basins

LocationType.name: sinkhole
LocationType.description: a small crater-shape depression in a karst area

LocationType.name: sisal plantation
LocationType.description: an estate that specializes in growing sisal

LocationType.name: slide
LocationType.description: a mound of earth material, at the base of a slope and the associated scoured area

LocationType.name: slope(s)
LocationType.description: a surface with a relatively uniform slope angle

LocationType.name: sluice
LocationType.description: a conduit or passage for carrying off surplus water from a waterbody, usually regulated by means of a sluice gate

LocationType.name: snowfield
LocationType.description: an area of permanent snow and ice forming the accumulation area of a glacier

LocationType.name: sound
LocationType.description: a long arm of the sea forming a channel between the mainland and an island or islands; or connecting two larger bodies of water

LocationType.name: spa
LocationType.description: a resort area usually developed around a medicinal spring

LocationType.name: space center
LocationType.description: a facility for launching, tracking, or controlling satellites and space vehicles

LocationType.name: spillway
LocationType.description: a passage or outlet through which surplus water flows over, around or through a dam

LocationType.name: spit
LocationType.description: a narrow, straight or curved continuation of a beach into a waterbody

LocationType.name: spring(s)
LocationType.description: a place where ground water flows naturally out of the ground

LocationType.name: spur(s)
LocationType.description: a subordinate ridge projecting outward from a hill, mountain or other elevation

LocationType.name: square
LocationType.description: a broad, open, public area near the center of a town or city

LocationType.name: stable
LocationType.description: a building for the shelter and feeding of farm animals, especially horses

LocationType.name: stadium
LocationType.description: a structure with an enclosure for athletic games with tiers of seats for spectators

LocationType.name: steps
LocationType.description: stones or slabs placed for ease in ascending or descending a steep slope

LocationType.name: stock route
LocationType.description: a route taken by livestock herds

LocationType.name: stony desert
LocationType.description: a desert plain characterized by a surface veneer of gravel and stones

LocationType.name: store
LocationType.description: a building where goods and/or services are offered for sale

LocationType.name: storehouse
LocationType.description: a building for storing goods, especially provisions

LocationType.name: strait
LocationType.description: a relatively narrow waterway, usually narrower and less extensive than a sound, connecting two larger bodies of water

LocationType.name: stream
LocationType.description: a body of running water moving to a lower level in a channel on land

LocationType.name: stream bank
LocationType.description: a sloping margin of a stream channel which normally confines the stream to its channel on land

LocationType.name: stream bend
LocationType.description: a conspicuously curved or bent segment of a stream

LocationType.name: stream gauging station
LocationType.description: named place where a measuring station for a watercourse, reservoir or other water body exists

LocationType.name: stream mouth(s)
LocationType.description: a place where a stream discharges into a lagoon, lake, or the sea

LocationType.name: streams
LocationType.description: bodies of running water moving to a lower level in a channel on land

LocationType.name: street
LocationType.description: a paved urban thoroughfare

LocationType.name: sub-surface dam
LocationType.description: a dam put down to bedrock in a sand river

LocationType.name: subway
LocationType.description: a railroad used for mass public transportation primarily in urban areas, all or part of the system may be located below, above, or at ground level

LocationType.name: subway station
LocationType.description: a facility comprising ticket office, platforms, etc. for loading and unloading subway passengers

LocationType.name: sugar mill
LocationType.description: a facility where sugar cane is processed into raw sugar

LocationType.name: sugar plantation
LocationType.description: an estate that specializes in growing sugar cane

LocationType.name: sugar refinery
LocationType.description: a facility for converting raw sugar into refined sugar

LocationType.name: sulphur spring(s)
LocationType.description: a place where sulphur ground water flows naturally out of the ground

LocationType.name: swamp
LocationType.description: a wetland dominated by tree vegetation

LocationType.name: synagogue
LocationType.description: a place for Jewish worship and religious instruction

LocationType.name: tablemount (or guyot)
LocationType.description: a seamount having a comparatively smooth, flat top

LocationType.name: tablemounts (or guyots)
LocationType.description: seamounts having a comparatively smooth, flat top

LocationType.name: talus slope
LocationType.description: a steep concave slope formed by an accumulation of loose rock fragments at the base of a cliff or steep slope

LocationType.name: tank farm
LocationType.description: a tract of land occupied by large, cylindrical, metal tanks in which oil or liquid petrochemicals are stored

LocationType.name: tea plantation
LocationType.description: an estate which specializes in growing tea bushes

LocationType.name: technical school
LocationType.description: post-secondary school with a specifically technical or vocational curriculum

LocationType.name: temple(s)
LocationType.description: an edifice dedicated to religious worship

LocationType.name: terminal
LocationType.description: airport facilities for the handling of freight and passengers

LocationType.name: terrace
LocationType.description: a long, narrow alluvial platform bounded by steeper slopes above and below, usually overlooking a waterbody

LocationType.name: territory
LocationType.description: territory

LocationType.name: third-order administrative division
LocationType.description: a subdivision of a second-order administrative division

LocationType.name: tidal creek(s)
LocationType.description: a meandering channel in a coastal wetland subject to bi-directional tidal currents

LocationType.name: tidal flat(s)
LocationType.description: a large flat area of mud or sand attached to the shore and alternately covered and uncovered by the tide

LocationType.name: tin mine(s)
LocationType.description: a mine where tin ore is extracted

LocationType.name: toll gate/barrier
LocationType.description: highway toll collection station

LocationType.name: tomb(s)
LocationType.description: a structure for interring bodies

LocationType.name: tower
LocationType.description: a high conspicuous structure, typically much higher than its diameter

LocationType.name: traffic circle
LocationType.description: a road junction formed around a central circle about which traffic moves in one direction only

LocationType.name: trail
LocationType.description: a path, track, or route used by pedestrians, animals, or off-road vehicles

LocationType.name: transit terminal
LocationType.description: facilities for the handling of vehicular freight and passengers

LocationType.name: tree(s)
LocationType.description: a conspicuous tree used as a landmark

LocationType.name: triangulation station
LocationType.description: a point on the earth whose position has been determined by triangulation

LocationType.name: tribal area
LocationType.description: a tract of land used by nomadic or other tribes

LocationType.name: tundra
LocationType.description: a marshy, treeless, high latitude plain, dominated by mosses, lichens, and low shrub vegetation under permafrost conditions

LocationType.name: tunnel
LocationType.description: a subterranean passageway for transportation

LocationType.name: tunnels
LocationType.description: subterranean passageways for transportation

LocationType.name: underground irrigation canal(s)
LocationType.description: a gently inclined underground tunnel bringing water for irrigation from aquifers

LocationType.name: underground lake
LocationType.description: a standing body of water in a cave

LocationType.name: undersea apron
LocationType.description: a gentle slope, with a generally smooth surface, particularly found around groups of islands and seamounts

LocationType.name: undersea arch
LocationType.description: a low bulge around the southeastern end of the island of Hawaii

LocationType.name: undersea arrugado
LocationType.description: an area of subdued corrugations off Baja California

LocationType.name: undersea bank
LocationType.description: an elevation, typically located on a shelf, over which the depth of water is relatively shallow but sufficient for safe surface navigation

LocationType.name: undersea banks
LocationType.description: elevations, typically located on a shelf, over which the depth of water is relatively shallow but sufficient for safe surface navigation

LocationType.name: undersea basin
LocationType.description: a depression more or less equidimensional in plan and of variable extent

LocationType.name: undersea bench
LocationType.description: a small terrace

LocationType.name: undersea borderland
LocationType.description: a region adjacent to a continent, normally occupied by or bordering a shelf, that is highly irregular with depths well in excess of those typical of a shelf

LocationType.name: undersea canyon
LocationType.description: a relatively narrow, deep depression with steep sides, the bottom of which generally has a continuous slope

LocationType.name: undersea canyons
LocationType.description: relatively narrow, deep depressions with steep sides, the bottom of which generally has a continuous slope

LocationType.name: undersea cordillera
LocationType.description: an entire mountain system including the subordinate ranges, interior plateaus, and basins

LocationType.name: undersea escarpment (or scarp)
LocationType.description: an elongated and comparatively steep slope separating flat or gently sloping areas

LocationType.name: undersea fan
LocationType.description: a relatively smooth feature normally sloping away from the lower termination of a canyon or canyon system

LocationType.name: undersea flat
LocationType.description: a small level or nearly level area

LocationType.name: undersea fork
LocationType.description: a branch of a canyon or valley

LocationType.name: undersea forks
LocationType.description: a branch of a canyon or valley

LocationType.name: undersea fracture zone
LocationType.description: an extensive linear zone of irregular topography of the sea floor, characterized by steep-sided or asymmetrical ridges, troughs, or escarpments

LocationType.name: undersea furrow
LocationType.description: a closed, linear, narrow, shallow depression

LocationType.name: undersea gap
LocationType.description: a narrow break in a ridge or rise

LocationType.name: undersea gully
LocationType.description: a small valley-like feature

LocationType.name: undersea hill
LocationType.description: an elevation rising generally less than 500 meters

LocationType.name: undersea hills
LocationType.description: elevations rising generally less than 500 meters

LocationType.name: undersea hole
LocationType.description: a small depression of the sea floor

LocationType.name: undersea knoll
LocationType.description: an elevation rising generally more than 500 meters and less than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summit

LocationType.name: undersea knolls
LocationType.description: elevations rising generally more than 500 meters and less than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summits

LocationType.name: undersea ledge
LocationType.description: a rocky projection or outcrop, commonly linear and near shore

LocationType.name: undersea levee
LocationType.description: an embankment bordering a canyon, valley, or seachannel

LocationType.name: undersea median valley
LocationType.description: the axial depression of the mid-oceanic ridge system

LocationType.name: undersea mesa
LocationType.description: an isolated, extensive, flat-topped elevation on the shelf, with relatively steep sides

LocationType.name: undersea moat
LocationType.description: an annular depression that may not be continuous, located at the base of many seamounts, islands, and other isolated elevations

LocationType.name: undersea mound
LocationType.description: a low, isolated, rounded hill

LocationType.name: undersea mountain
LocationType.description: a well-delineated subdivision of a large and complex positive feature

LocationType.name: undersea mountains
LocationType.description: well-delineated subdivisions of a large and complex positive feature

LocationType.name: undersea peak
LocationType.description: a prominent elevation, part of a larger feature, either pointed or of very limited extent across the summit

LocationType.name: undersea peaks
LocationType.description: prominent elevations, part of a larger feature, either pointed or of very limited extent across the summit

LocationType.name: undersea pinnacle
LocationType.description: a high tower or spire-shaped pillar of rock or coral, alone or cresting a summit

LocationType.name: undersea plain
LocationType.description: a flat, gently sloping or nearly level region

LocationType.name: undersea plateau
LocationType.description: a comparatively flat-topped feature of considerable extent, dropping off abruptly on one or more sides

LocationType.name: undersea platform
LocationType.description: a flat or gently sloping underwater surface extending seaward from the shore

LocationType.name: undersea province
LocationType.description: a region identifiable by a group of similar physiographic features whose characteristics are markedly in contrast with surrounding areas

LocationType.name: undersea ramp
LocationType.description: a gentle slope connecting areas of different elevations

LocationType.name: undersea range
LocationType.description: a series of associated ridges or seamounts

LocationType.name: undersea ravine
LocationType.description: a small canyon

LocationType.name: undersea reef
LocationType.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of consolidated material

LocationType.name: undersea reefs
LocationType.description: surface-navigation hazards composed of consolidated material

LocationType.name: undersea ridge
LocationType.description: a long narrow elevation with steep sides

LocationType.name: undersea ridges
LocationType.description: long narrow elevations with steep sides

LocationType.name: undersea rise
LocationType.description: a broad elevation that rises gently, and generally smoothly, from the sea floor

LocationType.name: undersea saddle
LocationType.description: a low part, resembling in shape a saddle, in a ridge or between contiguous seamounts

LocationType.name: undersea shelf
LocationType.description: a zone adjacent to a continent (or around an island) that extends from the low water line to a depth at which there is usually a marked increase of slope towards oceanic depths

LocationType.name: undersea shelf edge
LocationType.description: a line along which there is a marked increase of slope at the outer margin of a continental shelf or island shelf

LocationType.name: undersea shelf valley
LocationType.description: a valley on the shelf, generally the shoreward extension of a canyon

LocationType.name: undersea shoal
LocationType.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of unconsolidated material

LocationType.name: undersea shoals
LocationType.description: hazards to surface navigation composed of unconsolidated material

LocationType.name: undersea sill
LocationType.description: the low part of an underwater gap or saddle separating basins, including a similar feature at the mouth of a fjord

LocationType.name: undersea slope
LocationType.description: the slope seaward from the shelf edge to the beginning of a continental rise or the point where there is a general reduction in slope

LocationType.name: undersea spur
LocationType.description: a subordinate elevation, ridge, or rise projecting outward from a larger feature

LocationType.name: undersea terrace
LocationType.description: a relatively flat horizontal or gently inclined surface, sometimes long and narrow, which is bounded by a steeper ascending slope on one side and by a steep descending slope on the opposite side

LocationType.name: undersea tongue
LocationType.description: an elongate (tongue-like) extension of a flat sea floor into an adjacent higher feature

LocationType.name: undersea trench
LocationType.description: a long, narrow, characteristically very deep and asymmetrical depression of the sea floor, with relatively steep sides

LocationType.name: undersea trough
LocationType.description: a long depression of the sea floor characteristically flat bottomed and steep sided, and normally shallower than a trench

LocationType.name: undersea valley
LocationType.description: a relatively shallow, wide depression, the bottom of which usually has a continuous gradient

LocationType.name: undersea valleys
LocationType.description: a relatively shallow, wide depression, the bottom of which usually has a continuous gradient

LocationType.name: United States Government Establishment
LocationType.description: a facility operated by the United States Government in Panama

LocationType.name: upland
LocationType.description: an extensive interior region of high land with low to moderate surface relief

LocationType.name: valley
LocationType.description: an elongated depression usually traversed by a stream

LocationType.name: valleys
LocationType.description: elongated depressions usually traversed by a stream

LocationType.name: veterinary facility
LocationType.description: a building or camp at which veterinary services are available

LocationType.name: vineyard
LocationType.description: a planting of grapevines

LocationType.name: vineyards
LocationType.description: plantings of grapevines

LocationType.name: volcano
LocationType.description: a conical elevation composed of volcanic materials with a crater at the top

LocationType.name: wadi
LocationType.description: a valley or ravine, bounded by relatively steep banks, which in the rainy season becomes a watercourse; found primarily in North Africa and the Middle East

LocationType.name: wadi bend
LocationType.description: a conspicuously curved or bent segment of a wadi

LocationType.name: wadi junction
LocationType.description: a place where two or more wadies join

LocationType.name: wadi mouth
LocationType.description: the lower terminus of a wadi where it widens into an adjoining floodplain, depression, or waterbody

LocationType.name: wadies
LocationType.description: valleys or ravines, bounded by relatively steep banks, which in the rainy season become watercourses; found primarily in North Africa and the Middle East

LocationType.name: wall
LocationType.description: a thick masonry structure, usually enclosing a field or building, or forming the side of a structure

LocationType.name: water mill
LocationType.description: a mill powered by running water

LocationType.name: water pumping station
LocationType.description: a facility for pumping water from a major well or through a pipeline

LocationType.name: water tank
LocationType.description: a contained pool or tank of water at, below, or above ground level

LocationType.name: watercourse
LocationType.description: a natural, well-defined channel produced by flowing water, or an artificial channel designed to carry flowing water

LocationType.name: waterfall(s)
LocationType.description: a perpendicular or very steep descent of the water of a stream

LocationType.name: waterhole(s)
LocationType.description: a natural hole, hollow, or small depression that contains water, used by man and animals, especially in arid areas

LocationType.name: waterworks
LocationType.description: a facility for supplying potable water through a water source and a system of pumps and filtration beds

LocationType.name: weir(s)
LocationType.description: a small dam in a stream, designed to raise the water level or to divert stream flow through a desired channel

LocationType.name: well
LocationType.description: a cylindrical hole, pit, or tunnel drilled or dug down to a depth from which water, oil, or gas can be pumped or brought to the surface

LocationType.name: wells
LocationType.description: cylindrical holes, pits, or tunnels drilled or dug down to a depth from which water, oil, or gas can be pumped or brought to the surface

LocationType.name: wetland
LocationType.description: an area subject to inundation, usually characterized by bog, marsh, or swamp vegetation

LocationType.name: whaling station
LocationType.description: a facility for butchering whales and processing train oil

LocationType.name: wharf(-ves)
LocationType.description: a structure of open rather than solid construction along a shore or a bank which provides berthing for ships and cargo-handling facilities

LocationType.name: whirlpool
LocationType.description: a turbulent, rotating movement of water in a stream

LocationType.name: wildlife reserve
LocationType.description: a tract of public land reserved for the preservation of wildlife

LocationType.name: windmill
LocationType.description: a mill or water pump powered by wind

LocationType.name: wreck
LocationType.description: the site of the remains of a wrecked vessel

LocationType.name: zone
LocationType.description: zone

LocationType.name: zoo
LocationType.description: a zoological garden or park where wild animals are kept for exhibition
